title: UK Covid alert level drops as NHS threat 'recedes'
description: The move to the second-highest level means the NHS is no longer at imminent risk of being overwhelmed.

title: Covid-19: UK alert level drops and PM defends grading plan
description: Five things you need to know about the coronavirus pandemic this Thursday evening.

title: Lady Gaga's dog-walker shot and bulldogs stolen
description: The star is offering a reward for the safe return of her French bulldogs Koji and Gustav.

title: 'Lemonade stand' boys get Gold Blue Peter badges for Yemen fundraising
description: Best friends Ayaan and Mikaeel raised £100,000 for those affected by the Yemen crisis.

title: Vauxhall: Talks over fate of Ellesmere Port plant 'productive'
description: The owner of the Ellesmere Port factory, which employs about 1,000 workers, is in talks with the government.

title: Ronald Pickup: Best Exotic Marigold Hotel actor dies
description: The 80-year-old actor passed away peacefully after a long illness, his agent says.

title: India beat England inside two days in remarkable third Test
description: England succumb to a 10-wicket defeat against India inside two days of a remarkable third Test in Ahmedabad.

title: Sebastian Coe gets vocal treatment after Radio 4 interview
description: A sharp-eared doctor noticed Lord Coe's voice was "gravelly" during a Today programme interview.

title: Could Alex Salmond bring down Nicola Sturgeon?
description: The next week could be bloody for the SNP as a Scottish Parliament inquiry concludes.

title: A-level and GCSE results plan a 'good compromise', PM says
description: Getting teachers to grade GCSE and A-level pupils in England will be "fair" and "durable", the PM says.

title: A-level and GCSE results: What do students and teachers think?
description: GCSEs and A-level exams cancelled in England by the pandemic are to be replaced by teachers' grades.

title: Get used to fewer trains, says rail body
description: Around one in 10 rail services should be cut while passenger numbers remain low, says Network Rail.

title: Sturgeon rejects 'confidentiality breach' claim over Salmond complainer
description: Nicola Sturgeon denies that the name of a woman who complained about Alex Salmond was passed to him during a government investigation.

title: England hooker George to start against Wales
description: Hooker Jamie George returns to the England starting XV as Eddie Jones selects an experienced team for Saturday's Six Nations game against unbeaten Wales in Cardiff.

title: France's Six Nations game against Scotland called off after coronavirus outbreak
description: Scotland's Six Nations match with France is unlikely to take place next weekend after a further Covid case in the home squad forced its postponement.

title: How 30,000 elephant 'selfies' will help in conservation
description: Researchers are developing new technology to help reduce human-elephant conflicts.

title: Pigeon interrupts Stormont committee meeting
description: Feathers are ruffled at Stormont as unflappable researcher Colin Pidgeon's cat delivers him a pigeon.

title: Blue Peter award given to Weston-super-Mare hamster
description: The CBBC show said it wanted to recognise how the hamster had helped her owner through lockdown.

title: Rough sleeper numbers 'down a third in a year'
description: Just under 2,700 people were sleeping rough on one autumn night in 2020, official estimates suggest.

title: Fit-again North to win 100th Wales cap against England
description: George North will win his 100th cap for Wales as he returns from injury for Saturday's Six Nations match against England.

title: Mary Anning: Fossil hunter celebrated with Jurassic 50p coins
description: The 19th Century fossil hunter's achievements were often overlooked during her own lifetime.

title: Princess Latifa urges UK police to reopen sister's kidnap case
description: Dubai ruler's captive daughter writes to British police about her sister's abduction 20 years ago.

title: Looming battle for Yemen's Marib city risks humanitarian disaster
description: A rebel attack on the government's northern stronghold of Marib threatens mass displacement.

title: Brazilian Amazon: Juma descendants of 'last warrior' vow to carry on legacy
description: After the death of the last male member of an indigenous group, his grandchildren take an unusual step.

title: Mother and son become tap-dance lockdown sensation
description: Lizzi Gee and her eight-year-old son Rufus say tap routines are one positive to come out of lockdown.

title: North Korea enslaved South Korean prisoners of war in coal mines
description: A report describes how prisoners of war are used as slave labour to generate money for the regime.

title: Kenya: A sustainable solution to locust swarms?
description: An NGO is training and paying communities in Kenya to catch locusts, so they can be turned into animal feed.

title: Inside a domestic violence call centre
description: Calls to a major domestic violence charity increased by more than 50 per cent during the pandemic in 2020.

title: The disabled influencers making their mark on social media
description: Brands are starting to embrace social media influencers with disabilities to target the "purple pound".

title: Have Australians fallen out of love with Sydney and Melbourne?
description: Figures show Australians are moving out of the large cities in search of a better quality of life.

title: Budget 2021: 'If I have to pay £13,000, it will destroy my shop'
description: Struggling shops warn they may have to shut if business rates are brought back at the Budget.
